column2: OREGON DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 2. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column8: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 3. Roads become very slippery:
column4: for the first 10 to 15 minutes of a rain storm.
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: when it's been raining for an hour or more.

column2: 4. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column8: Winding road ahead
column10: A road joins from the left

column2: 6. A speed restriction sign:
column6: shows the recommended speed for a curve/turn.
column8: must be ignored in snow conditions.

column2: 7. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column8: never take precedence over

column2: 8. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column6: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column8: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column10: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 9. This is:
column8: a right curve sign.

column2: 10. Work zone signs:
column4: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.
column6: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
column8: mean that road conditions will improve soon.
column10: mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column8: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 12. A road is likely to be most slippery:
column8: when tire marks have been left by other vehicles.
column10: when icy and the temperature is near freezing.

column2: 13. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column6: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.
column8: Weaving between lanes.

column2: 14. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.

column2: 15. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 16. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 17. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column6: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column8: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column10: steer the car into the direction of the skid.

column2: 18. A steady green light at intersections means:
column6: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding
column8: You may not turn right
column10: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column8: Railroad Crossing

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way
column8: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 21. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: even if they are short sighted.
column8: BEFORE you move.

column2: 22. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column8: fix

column2: 23. ___________ are the most frequent fatality in work zone crashes.
column8: Construction workers

column2: 24. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
column6: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column8: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column10: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.

column2: 25. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: slow down until it passes you.
column8: pull over to the side of the road and stop.
column10: increase your speed to provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle.

column2: 26. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 27. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 28. This sign means:
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: Keep to the left.

column2: 29. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 30. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column6: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column8: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column10: Passing is not permitted in either direction

column2: 31. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column6: You should look over your shoulder instead.
column8: Mirrors are useless.
column10: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 32. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column8: No.
column10: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 33. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column8: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 34. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column8: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column6: There is a traffic signal ahead
column8: Lane closed for traffic
